Package com.github.ivanjermakov.jtrue.validator

Class Validator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ivanjermakov.jtrue.validator.Validator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - validated object type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Validatable<T>
    public class Validator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Validatable<T>
    Main implementation of Validatable. Used to validate java object instances.

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate​(T target)
        Checks whether target object is valid or not. Object is valid if none of the Validator.RuleResult result is false.

        This is a terminal operation.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface Validatable<T>
        Parameters:
        target - target object
        Returns:
        true if object is valid, false otherwise

      • rule

        public Validator<T> rule​(@NotNull
                         @NotNull java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Add new rule to this validator. Target object is valid if all rule's predicates are true for that object.

        This is intermediate operation.
        Parameters:
        predicate - validation rule
        Returns:
        validator, configured for that rule

      • rule

        public Validator<T> rule​(@NotNull
                         @NotNull java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate,
                         @NotNull
                         @NotNull java.lang.String message)
        Add new rule to this validator. Target object is valid if all rule's predicates are true for that object.

        This is intermediate operation.
        Parameters:
        predicate - validation rule
        message - error message for failing this rule. Can be used with terminal operation #listErrors(T)
        Returns:
        validator, configured for that rule

      • field

        public <F> Validator<T> field​(@NotNull
                              @NotNull java.util.function.Function<T,​F> mapFunction,
                              @NotNull
                              @NotNull java.util.function.Function<Validator<F>,​Validator<F>> validatorFunction)
        Validate certain field of a target object.

        This is intermediate operation.
        Type Parameters:
        F - field type
        Parameters:
        mapFunction - mapping function, returns field value
        validatorFunction - function that passes new new Validator<F>() for further field validation. Must receive configured validator back. TODO: example
        Returns:
        Validator, configured to validate specified field

      • throwInvalid

        public void throwInvalid​(T target)
                  throws InvalidObjectException
        Throws InvalidObjectException with default error message: "invalid object", when target is invalid.

        This is a terminal operation.
        Parameters:
        target - verification target object
        Throws:
        InvalidObjectException - when target is invalid

                                                         @NotNull

        Throws specified exception when target is invalid.

        This is a terminal operation.
        Parameters:

        errorSupplier - supplier of exception to be thrown

        E - when target is invalid
        E extends java.lang.Throwable

      • throwInvalid

        public <E extends java.lang.Throwable> void throwInvalid​(T target,
                                                         @NotNull
                                                         @NotNull java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,​E> errorSupplier)
                                                  throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
        Throws specified exception with formatted message when target is invalid.

        This is a terminal operation.
        Parameters:
        target - verification target object
        errorSupplier - supplier of exception to be thrown. String argument represents error message, generated from #listErrors(T) method
        Throws:
        E - when target is invalid
        E extends java.lang.Throwable

      • listErrors

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> listErrors​(T target)
        List errors from all failed rule checks.

        Error message can be specified calling rule(Predicate, String). Default message is "invalid object". This is a terminal operation.
        Parameters:
        target - verification target object
        Returns:
        list of error messages

        public Validator<T> message​(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> messageFunction)
